content.question:
Researchers are examining the relationship between hours of sleep and athletic performance among college athletes. Athletic performance will be measured on a numeric scale, with greater numbers indicating better performance. The researchers expect that the more hours the athletes sleep, the better they will perform. Assuming all conditions for inference are met, the researchers will create a <math alttext="95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval for the slope of the regression line for predicting athletic performance from amount of sleep.
For which of the following would the confidence interval support the researchers’ expectations?

choices.label: The confidence interval includes only positive values.
The confidence interval includes only negative values.
The confidence interval has a width less than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The confidence interval has a width greater than <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The confidence interval includes the value <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The confidence interval includes only positive values.

topic.text: 9.3: Justifying a Claim About the Slope of a Regression Model Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Justify a claim based on a confidence interval.
